author: sfgate.com
title: Daily Briefing, Oct. 21
text:
D’oh! 
Consumer Reports said Tuesday it no longer recommends the Tesla Model S, citing “an array of detailed and complicated maladies” from 1,400 owners in its annual auto survey. The magazine still says the sporty electric Model S is the “best performing car we’ve ever tested.” But owners reported problems with everything from the car’s drivetrain and charging equipment to “body and sunroof squeaks, rattles, and leaks,” according to the magazine. The thumbs-down sent Tesla stock spiraling, with shares falling as much as 11 percent Tuesday before recovering a bit to close down 6.6 percent. Page C4. 
In case you missed it 
If all you want for Christmas is your very own drone, the Obama administration has another present for you: You’re going to have to register it. The U.S. Transportation Department is creating a task force to recommend how to keep tabs on the swelling number of private drone operators. According to Bloomberg, federal administrators are hoping to beat the holiday sales rush, with Transportation Secretary Anthony Foxx asking the task force to complete its work by Nov. 20 and finalize the requirement before Christmas.
Doing it right 
Google said Tuesday it will acquire a stake in what will be Africa’s largest wind farm once the facility in Kenya is completed in 2017. This marks the company’s second big investment in Africa’s renewable energy industry, according to the Washington Post. The project could save Kenya more than $113 million per year in imported fuel costs.
The Daily Briefing is compiled from San Francisco Chronicle staff and news services. See more items and links at www.sfgate.com . Twitter: @techchronicle
